Scripting Documentation - shhArc Engine (0.001)

Scripting Documentation - shhArc Engine (0.001)

[Overview] [Scripts] [Agents] [Library and Component Reference]


Overview

The shhArc agent system is based upon the Lua scripting language. The Lua reference manual is available here.

The shhArc engine supports multiple simulated worlds. In order to do this it has a God object that manages the worlds. The God object has its own agent system that can be used for world managing agents or even user interface agents within a game. It also has a virtual machine used for booting the engine, creating agents and worlds and manipulating them. Each world has its own agent system and virtual machine. Agents in different worlds do not know about each other unless informed by God vm/agents. An agent can have sub processes and these can either be used to execute scripts or as Nodes belonging to the agent. Agents can communicate with each other via a sandboxed messageing system. Agents also contain Parts which are simply smart pointers to any in engine object you wish an agent to have. The engine is written is C++ and is designed to be extensible so you can easily add your own data types to be used in scripts and also your own C functions that can be called from script. So you can implement functions that can be called from agent scripts to create and manipluate Parts within an agent.

Nodes are processes within an agent and like agents have their own script. They can also comunicate with each other via the sandboxed messaging system but only with other nodes within the same agent and to their owning agent. Nodes also have input and output interfaces which can be connected to those in other nodes via edges to facilitate fast transfer of information The engine uses schema files which are in the JSON format and are used to specify and quickly construct networks of different types of nodes with an agent.





Scripts

Boot scripts are placed in the runtime sub directory defined with the path label BOOT defined in the path config file. The engine may be run with

-boot script_file_name

to boot from a particular script, otherwise 'default.lua' is used.


Agents

Agents scripts are placed in a directory along with all of their assets. Agent directories are placed in the runtime sub directory with path label AGENT defined in the path config file. God agents are placed in the further sub directory God. World agents are placed in the sub directory World. Further sub directories exist for each language implementation. It is in the latter that the specific agent directories are placed.

Agent Class Definition

Agent scripts start with the agent class definition on the first line:

--< agent_name > specializes (< base_class_agent_name > | Agent) [abstract | final]

  • agent_name - must be the same as the agent script file name (obviously excluding the suffix)

  • base_class_agent_name - the name of the agent inherited from. If it does not inherit from anything use the token Agent

  • abstract - specifies that the agent can not be instantiated and therefore is only used for specialization

  • final -specifies that the agent can not be specialized and therefore is only instantiated


    • Nodes

    Nodes scripts are placed in a directory along with all of their assets. Nodes are placed in the runtime sub directory with path label NODE defined in the path config file. God nodes are placed in the further sub directory God. World nodes are placed in the sub directory World. Further sub sirectories exist for each language implementation. It is in the latter that the specific node directories are placed.

    Node Class Definition

    Node scripts start with the node class definition on the first line:

    --< node_name > specializes (< base_class_node_name > | Node) [abstract | final]

  • node_name - must be the same as the node script file name (obviously excluding the suffix)

  • base_class_node_name - the name of the node inherited from. If it does not inherit from anything use the token Node

  • abstract - specifies that the node can not be instantiated and therefore is only used for specialization

  • final - specifies that the node can not be specialized and therefore is only instantiated


    • Agent/Node Member Functions

    The agent/node public interface imposes sandboxed messaging. This means that variables passed either way are copied so that the agent/node own internal variable values can not be tampered with outside of itself. Agents/Nodes can optionally have a function called shhInitialize which will be called when the agent is created. Agents/Nodes can also optionally have a function called shhFinalize which will be called when the agent is destroyed. Finalize functions can take no arguments. Functions that start with the shhMessage prefix are public. Functions that start with the shhTimer prefix are called regularly at a given interval. All other functions are protected:

  • shhMessage - messages are accessable by other agents/nodes and virtual machines using shh.SendMsg. Agents can send messages to each other and return values. Nodes can send messages to each other and return values. Messages can not be sent to nodes from outside of thier agent.

  • shhTimer - messages which are regularlty called at a time interval. This is set using shh.SetTimer


    • The functions with the following engine prefixes can only be called by the engine:

  • shhUpdate - messages which are regularlty called by the engine.

  • shhSystem - messages are called by the engine for special purposes. For example, collision callbacks.

  • shhStatic - messages are for the entire agent/node class not each agent/node instanciation. For example, the shhStaticInject function is used by the engine debugger for agent/node injection.

    • Agent/Node Specialization

    Agent and Node specializations implements protected inheritance and virtual functions. All base agent class functions that are overridden by derived agent/node classes are prefixed with the base agent/node class name followed by a tripple underscore and then the function name. For example, if the base class BasePlant function RecieveLight is overridden in a derived class it will be called BasePlant__RecieveLight.


    Module Reference

    shhArc modules are available to processes, agents, and nodes with the correct privileges as defined in the config file. The privileges are:

  • God - not available to agents in a world
  • World - only available to agents in a world
  • Agent - only available to agents
  • Node - only available to nodes
  • Updater - only available to update scripts


    • Any thing that does not specify a privledge is accessable by all.

    Agent (type) - Members functions of Agent type.
    Classifier (type) - Collection of labels.
    Config Variables - Engine parameters you can alter.
    Environment (type) - Controls manipulation of worlds and related variables.
    Node (type) -
    Object (type) - Generic object functions.
    System (library) - Operating system level functions.
    shh (library) - Messaging and process functions aswell as variable copying, testing, debug tracing.

    Global variables

    Read these with shh.GetGlobal and alter them with shh.SetGlobal

    Variable nameDefault valueDescription

    Local variables

    Read these with shh.GetLocal and alter them with shh.SetLocal

    Variable nameDefault valueDescription

    Meta variables

    Meta variavles can not be got or set from script

    Variable nameDefault valueDescription
    max_update_time0.02Chunk size of Realm updates, for example neurons are updated this often in simulation time.

    Agent type

    Members functions of Agent type.

    integer Agent:CreateCollection(string collection_name )
    Member: Agent (replace token Agent with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent
    Description: Creates a new collection to store parts in.

    Agent:DestroyCollection(string_or_integer collection_name_or_id)
    Member: Agent (replace token Agent with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent
    Description: Destroys a collection and all its parts.

    Agent:DestoryPart(string_or_integer collection_name_or_id , string_or_integer part_name_or_id)
    Member: Agent (replace token Agent with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent
    Description: Destroys a part.

    Classifier type

    Collection of labels.

    boolean TypeCheck.Classifier(Classifier variable)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns whether variable is a Classifier.

    classifier Classifier()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a newly created classiffier.

    Classifier:Clear()
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Clears the classifier.

    Classifier:Add(string label_to_add)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Adds a string label to the Classifier.

    Classifier:Remove(string label_to_remove)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Removes a string label from the Classifier.

    boolean Classifier:Intersect(classifier other)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns whether the Classifier labels intersect with given others labels.

    boolean Classifier:Superset(classifier other)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns whether classifier matches exactly or is a superset of other classifier.

    boolean Classifier:Subset(classifier other)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns whether the Classifier matches exactly or is a subset of other.

    string Classifier:DumpString()
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the list of labels in classifier as a space separated string.

    Classifier:+(classifier arg1, classifier arg2)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a classifiers that is the combination of arg1 and arg2.

    Classifier:-(Classifier arg1, Classifier arg2)
    Member: Classifier (replace token Classifier with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a classifier that is arg1 with any labels in arg2 removed from it.

    Environment type

    Controls manipulation of worlds and related variables.

    boolean Environment.CreateWorld(string world_name, string name_of_template_realm)
    Privilege: God
    Description: Creates a new world from a template Realm to create from, returns bool if successfull.

    boolean Environment.DestroyWorld(string world_name)
    Privilege: God
    Description: Destorys a world. Returns bool if successfull.

    boolean Environment.EnterWorld(string world_name)
    Privilege: God
    Description: Enters the world for God agents and scripts to operate in. Returns bool if successfull.

    Environment.ExitWorld()
    Privilege: God
    Description: Exists the currently entered world the God agent or script is currently in.

    any_type Environment.GetLocal(string variable_name, any_type default)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a local (Realm) variable of a given name. Returns default if variable doesnt exist.

    any_type Environment.GetGlobal(string variable_name, any_type default)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a global variable of a given name. Return default if variable doesnt exist.

    Environment.SetLocal(string variable_name, any_type value_to_set)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Sets a local (Realm) variable of a given name.

    Environment.SetGlobal(string variable_name, any_type value_to_set)
    Privilege: God
    Description: Sets a global variable of a given name.

    table objects Environment.GetObjects(string object_type)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Gets all object of a particular type from the environment/agent

    Node type

    Schema Node functions

    boolean Node:Destroy()
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent, Node
    Description: Destroys a Node and all its child nodes and returns true if successful.

    Node:DestroyChildNodes()
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent, Node
    Description: Destroys all child nodes and returns true if successful.

    table_of_nodes Node:GetChildNodes()
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent, Node
    Description: Returns a table of all child nodes.

    boolean Node:CreateInputInterface(string interface_id, integer size_of_iterface)
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Creates an input interface of the given name with the given size, returns if successful.

    boolean Node:CreateOutputInterface(string interface_id, integer size_of_iterface)
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Creates an output interface of the given name with the given size, returns if successful.

    boolean Node:CreateEdge(integer id_index_of_source_node, string source_node_interface_id, string destination_node_interface_id)
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Creates an edge from the interface of the given name in the source node to the interface of the given name in this node. A negative source index selects a node from my siblings, and positive index selects a node from my children. Return bool if successful.

    double Node:ReadInput(string input_interface_id, integer variable_within_interface)
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the variable value of a given index in the input interface of the given name.

    Node:WriteOutput(string output_interface_id, integer variable_within_interface, double value_of_variable)
    Member: Node (replace token Node with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Writes the variable value to a given index in the output interface of the given name.

    Object type

    Generic object functions. Token "Object" should be repkaced with Agent or Node variable names

    boolean TypeCheck.Object(Object object)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns whether variable is an Object. Call using class name token. Agent or Node instead of tolen token Object, e.g: TypeCheck.Node(variable_name)

    object Object(string class_name, variable_arg optional_variable)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Creates an object of the given class. Call using class name token Agent or Node instead of token Object.

    boolean Object:Destroy(Object object)
    Member: Object (replace token Object with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Destorys an object, returns if successfull.

    boolean Object:IsValid(Object object)
    Member: Object (replace token Object with variable name)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns true if an object is valid.

    object Object:This()
    Member: Object (replace token Object with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent, Node
    Description: Returns object that this process belongs to.

    boolean Object:ExpressSchema(string schema_filename, string meta_schema_filename)
    Member: Object (replace token Object with variable name)
    Privilege: Agent, Node
    Description: Expresses a schema file, returns if successfull.

    System library

    Operating system level functions.

    double System.AbsoluteTime()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the system time.

    string System.DateTimeString()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns data and time as a string.

    string System.GMDateTimeString()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns Greenwich Mean Time and Date as a string.

    string System.USADateTimeString()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns USA date and time as a string.

    boolean System.IsValidPath(string path)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Checks if path exists.

    table_of_strings System.GetDirectoryContents(string directory+path, string wildcard, int flags)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns table of the contents of the directory path. flags: GetFiles = 1, GetDirectories = 2, GetEverything = 3

    string System.GetLabeledPath(string label)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the path that of given label.

    System.SetLabeledPath(string label, string path)
    Privilege: God
    Description: Sets the path that of given label.

    shh library

    Messaging and process functions aswell as variable copying, testing, debug tracing.

    cloned_type shh.DeepCopy(any_type data_to_clone)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Used to make a clone copy my value of data_to_clone argument and returns it.

    boolean shh.DeepCompare(any_type value1, any_type value2)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Used to compare by value two paramaters. Returns true if equal false if not.

    shh.LogError(string message)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Function that tells Process when an error occurs.

    shh.ErrorBox(string format, variable_arg optional_variable)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Used to print data to an error box. Use a % sign in the format string to designate where an argument is to be printed. You may have any number of arguments following the format string. Each argument may be a number, string or system code. An standard engine error box is displayed.

    shh.Trace(string format, variable_arg optional_variable)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Used to print data to the output stream. Use a % sign in the format string to designate where an argument is to be printed. You may have any number of arguments following the format string. Each argument may be a number, string or system code.

    shh.FilterTrace(classifier filter_attribute_lables)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Allows only traces with any of the given classifier labels to be output.

    shh.ExecuteFile(string filename, variable_args optional_variables)
    Privilege: Agent, Script
    Description: Executes a script file of the name given in a new temporarily spawned new Process. The file must be in the scripts directory. Also optionally calls function Main() within script which may accept and return args if it exists. Number of arguments accepted is arbitary.

    shh.ExecuteString(string code, variable_args optional_variables)
    Privilege: Agent, Script
    Description: The file must be in the scripts directory. Also optionally calls function Main() within script which may accept and returns args if it exists. Number of arguments accepted is arbitary.

    optional_returned_arguments shh.SendMsg(Agent_Schema receiver, double delay, string callback_function_name, string function_name_to_call)
    Privilege: Agent, Script
    Description: Sends a message to an Agent/Schema. Optional additonal arguments may be sent to the agent.

    integer shh.SetTimer(Agent_Schema receiver, double message_delay_intervals, string message_name )
    Privilege: Agent, Script
    Description: Sends a timer message to a process. Returns if successful and the timer id.

    boolean shh.StopTimer(integer timer_id )
    Privilege: Agent, Script
    Description: Stops a timer message running on an Agent/Schema.

    shh.YieldProcess()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Yields the currently active Process.

    double shh.GetMsgScheduledTime()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the time the current message was scheduled for.

    double shh.GetMsgRecievedTime()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the time the current message was received.

    double shh.GetMsgDelta()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns the time delta of current message (used for timers and update messages).

    bool shh.InitializeModule(string module_id, table config_dictionary)
    Privilege: Updater
    Description: Used by updater scripts to make a initialize a module.

    bool shh.FinalizeModule(string module_id)
    Privilege: Updater
    Description: Used by updater scripts finalize a module.

    bool shh.UpdateModule(string module_id, double time_to_update_until, integer phase_of_update)
    Privilege: Updater
    Description: Used by updater scripts update a module.

    bool shh.UpdateScheduler(double time_to_update_until, integer phase_of_update)
    Privilege: Updater
    Description: Used by updater scripts update a scheduler.

    boolean shh.Vector(param variable)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Position or offest in a 3D world. Returns whether variable is a Vector

    Vector shh.Vector()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a newly created vector

    Vector shh.Vector(vector to copy)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a newly created vector

    Vector shh.Vector(param x, param y, param z)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a newly created vector

    length shh.GetLength()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a newly created vector

    length shh.GetLengthSquared()
    Privilege: All
    Description: Returns a newly created vector

    this shh.Normalise()
    Privilege: All
    Description: normalises vector

    this shh.Inverse()
    Privilege: All
    Description: inverts vector

    dot product shh.Dot(param other)
    Privilege: All
    Description: calculated dot product

    cross product shh.Cross(param other)
    Privilege: All
    Description: calculated cross product

    this shh.Interpolate(vector a, vector b, param range)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Set this vector between vectors a & b, t: range: 0.0..1.0, 0.0 -> this = a, 1.0 -> this = b.

    boolean shh.Tolerates(vector a, vector b, param tollerance)
    Privilege: All
    Description: Tests if two vectors are within tollerance of each other
